New Records: Adolis Garcia set a record for RBIs in a postseason series with 15.
Garcia also set a record for most home runs in a postseason series with 6.
Garcia passed Yordan Alvarez for the most home runs in the playoffs this year with 7.
Garcia's home run streak is tied for fourth-longest in postseason history.
Key Match Events: Rangers jumped on Cristian Javier immediately and tagged him for three runs, highlighted by Corey Seager's second-deck shot.
Seager had three hits after starting the series 5 for 26.
Garcia slugged his sixth home run this postseason to make it 4-1 in the third.
Texas broke things open with a four-run fourth that featured a two-run double by rookie Evan Carter and a two-run single by Garcia.
Garcia had 15 RBIs in the series to break the record set by Nelson Cruz with 13 for Texas in the 2011 ALCS.
Garcia added a solo shot in the eighth to give him seven homers and 20 RBIs this postseason.
Jose Altuve hit his 27th career postseason homer in the ninth for Houston, two behind Manny Ramirez for most all-time.
Pre-Game Insights: The Rangers were on a streak of 8-0 away from home in the playoffs.
Bruce Bochy became the first skipper to win a League Championship Series with three different teams.
The Rangers were looking to win their first World Series in 12 years.
Post-Match Reflections: Bruce Bochy said 'I didn't know if I'd get back in it. And here I am. I know how blessed I am.'
Bochy highlighted the team's resilience and their ability to come back from adversity.
Dusty Baker said 'We have been spoiled around here as far as winning and winning and winning.'
Baker emphasized that the team has nothing to be ashamed of and that they're not out yet.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers will open an all-wild card World Series at home Friday night against Arizona or Philadelphia.
This is the third all-wild card World Series since 2014.
The Astros were finally dethroned after being the defending World Series champion.
The Rangers have gone 8-0 away from home in the playoffs, joining the 1996 Yankees as the only teams to win their first eight road games in one postseason.
Others: The Rangers' win guaranteed a third all-wild card World Series.
The Rangers' victory marked the second time the road team won every game in a best-of-seven postseason series.
